author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Mahila Court on Tuesday sentenced a youth to two 10-year terms for abducting and raping a minor girl.

Two of his accomplices were awarded 10-year terms for abetment.

Saravanan (31) of Aranthangi in Pudukottai district, a tantric practitioner, was punished for raping 17-year-old daughter of a debt-ridden man in Karunkalpalayam limits. Saravanan was invited to the girl’s house by a relative to extricate her father from the financial crisis using tantric powers.

While staying in the house, Saravanan had developed intimacy with the girl. Holding out promise of marriage, he eloped with the girl taking the help of her relative Muthubava (27), a vegetable trader of B.P. Agraharam, who had invited him and his accomplice Wasim Akram (24), a driver.

The three youth took the girl to Pudukottai, and from there to Andhra Pradesh, where Saravanan had married her in a Dargah during 2014.

Based on a complaint preferred by the girl’s father, the police arrested them from Andhra Pradesh.

The Mahila Court judge Thirunavakarasu imposed a fine of Rs. 10,000 too on all the three.
title: Jail term for three for raping minor girl
